item.title: Ethernet Networks Interconnect in Arizona
item.description: Ethernet is quickly gaining popularity as the preferred protocol for metropolitan and wide area networks. It’s predicted that IP networks using standard Ethernet services will eventually replace the outdated Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN). The main obstacle to this is the fragmented nature of Ethernet service providers, comprising a mix of established and newer carriers with limited service areas. However, E-NNI technology is emerging as the solution to connect these disparate networks.
